Edward I. Kelly, Sr..label: Edward I. Kelly, Sr.
Edward I. Kelly, Sr..description: Edward Ignatius "Eddie" Kelly, Sr. was a Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. Wikipedia

Gary C. Contessa.label: Gary C. Contessa
Gary C. Contessa.description:
Gary C. Contessa is an American horse trainer in the sport of Thoroughbred horse racing. He became a professional trainer in 1984.
From 2006 through 2008, Gary Contessa led all New York Racing Association trainers in wins. Wikipedia

James P. Conway.label: James P. Conway
James P. Conway.description: James P. Conway was an American Hall of Fame trainer in Thoroughbred horse racing who trained forty-three stakes winners including five Champions and a winner of two American Classic Races. Wikipedia

Ernie T. Poulos.label: Ernie T. Poulos
Ernie T. Poulos.description: Ernest T. Poulos was an American Thoroughbred horse trainer. A native of Chicago, he conditioned horses at local tracks beginning in 1952 but gained national attention when he took over the training of Black Tie Affair in 1989. Wikipedia

Aidan O'Brien.label: Aidan O'Brien
Aidan O'Brien.description: Aidan Patrick O'Brien is an Irish horse racing trainer. Since 1996, he has been the private trainer at Ballydoyle Stables near Cashel in County Tipperary for John Magnier and his Coolmore Stud associates. Wikipedia
Aidan O'Brien.Born: October 16, 1969 (age 44), County Wexford, Republic of Ireland
Education: St Augustine's and Good Counsel College

Robert E. Holthus.label: Robert E. Holthus
Robert E. Holthus.description: Robert E. "Bob" Holthus was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. As a second generation trainer, Holthus learned the profession from his father, Paul Holthus. Wikipedia
Robert E. Holthus.Born: June 24, 1934, Table Rock, Nebraska, United States

Clyde Van Dusen.label: Clyde Van Dusen
Clyde Van Dusen.description: Clyde Van Dusen was an American Thoroughbred racehorse and the winner of the 1929 Kentucky Derby. Wikipedia

John Gosden.label: John Gosden
John Gosden.description: John Gosden is a British racehorse trainer. He has trained over 2,000 winners since his return to England in 1989, including winners of the Breeders' Cup Classic, the Derby, the King George, the Eclipse, the 1,000 Guineas and the St. Leger. Wikipedia

Henry Cecil.label: Henry Cecil
Henry Cecil.description: Sir Henry Richard Amherst Cecil was a British flat racing horse trainer. He was widely regarded as one of the greatest trainers in history. Wikipedia

Oscar White.label: Oscar White
Oscar White.description: Oscar White was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer who twice won the third leg of the United States Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing. Wikipedia

Ronald W. Ellis.label: Ronald W. Ellis
Ronald W. Ellis.description: Ronald W. Ellis is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer. A November 8, 1997 Los Angeles Times article noted that he "is known for taking his time with horses and taking special care with those prone to injury." Wikipedia

Gai Waterhouse.label: Gai Waterhouse
Gai Waterhouse.description: Gabriel Marie "Gai" Waterhouse is an Australian horse trainer and businesswoman. The daughter of Tommy J. Smith, a leading trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses, Waterhouse was born in Scotland but raised in Sydney. Wikipedia

Mesh Tenney.label: Mesh Tenney
Mesh Tenney.description:
Meshach A. "Mesh" Tenney was an American Thoroughbred horse trainer.
From Arizona, Mesh Tenney began his career as a Thoroughbred trainer in the western United States in 1935. Wikipedia

Edward Plesa, Jr..label: Edward Plesa, Jr.
Edward Plesa, Jr..description: Edward "Eddie" Plesa, Jr. is a Thoroughbred racehorse trainer and owner. The son of jockey and trainer Edward Plesa, Sr., he is married to Laurie and has three children Luke, Kyle, and Kelsey. The couple currently reside in South Florida. Wikipedia

John M. Gaver, Sr..label: John M. Gaver, Sr.
John M. Gaver, Sr..description:
John Milton Gaver, Sr. was an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
Born in Mount Airy, Maryland, John Gaver graduated from Princeton University then worked as a prep school language ... Wikipedia
John M. Gaver, Sr..Born: October 29, 1900, Mount Airy, Maryland, United States

Budd Lepman.label: Budd Lepman
Budd Lepman.description: Budd Lepman was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer who trained two Champions, won a record five training titles at Monmouth Park Racetrack, and by the early 1970s was regarded as "one of the nation's leading trainers". Wikipedia

Helen Pitts-Blasi.label: Helen Pitts-Blasi
Helen Pitts-Blasi.description: Helen Pitts-Blasi is an American trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses. Wikipedia

Andreas Schütz.label: Andreas Schütz
Andreas Schütz.description: Andreas Schütz is a Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. From a prominent racing family, he is the fourth generation to train professionally. Wikipedia

Harvey L. Vanier.label: Harvey L. Vanier
Harvey L. Vanier.description: Harvey L. Vanier is a trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses. With his wife Nancy Aiken-Vanier, they own and breed racehorses on their Fairberry Farm in Waterloo, Illinois. Wikipedia

Mouse Morris.label: Mouse Morris
Mouse Morris.description: Michael 'Mouse' Morris is an Irish racehorse trainer and former professional jockey. Wikipedia
Mouse Morris.Born: April 4, 1951 (age 62), County Galway, Republic of Ireland

Moody Jolley.label: Moody Jolley
Moody Jolley.description: Moody Jolley was an American thoroughbred horse racing owner, breeder and trainer. He began his professional training career in the mid-1930s and by 1940 had his first Kentucky Derby runner. Wikipedia

Sid C. Attard.label: Sid C. Attard
Sid C. Attard.description: Sid C. Attard is a Canada-based thoroughbred horse racing trainer. Members of his family emigrated to Canada in the 1960s, and his older brothers Joseph and Tino became racehorse trainers. Wikipedia

William C. Winfrey.label: William C. Winfrey
William C. Winfrey.description:
William C. "Bill" Winfrey was an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
His father died when he was 3, and two years later his mother married Trainer Carey Winfrey Bill Winfrey was born Colin Dickard. Wikipedia

David R. Vance.label: David R. Vance
David R. Vance.description:
David R. Vance is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer who has won more than 3,000 races.
Vance has won three training titles at Churchill Downs, three at Keystone Racetrack and two at the now defunct Garden State Park. Wikipedia

David Cotey.label: David Cotey
David Cotey.description: David Cotey is a Canadian Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. Near the beginning of the 1990s, he formed the nom de course Dominion Bloodstock to purchase and race Thoroughbreds with partners Hugh Galbraith and Derek Ball. Wikipedia

Gary Sciacca.label: Gary Sciacca
Gary Sciacca.description:
Gary Sciacca is an American horse trainer in the sport of Thoroughbred horse racing.
Sciacca earned his first win as a professional trainer on October 21, 1981 at New York's Aqueduct Racetrack. Wikipedia
Gary Sciacca.Born: March 10, 1960 (age 54), Brooklyn, New York, United States

Jean-Claude Rouget.label: Jean-Claude Rouget
Jean-Claude Rouget.description: Jean-Claude Rouget is a French Thoroughbred horse trainer and former jockey. Wikipedia

Peter Walwyn.label: Peter Walwyn
Peter Walwyn.description: Peter Tyndall Walwyn MBE is a retired British racehorse trainer. He was based at stables at in the Lambourn, Berkshire, area and enjoyed his period of greatest success in the mid-1970s when he was British flat racing Champion Trainer twice. Wikipedia

Richard E. Dutrow, Jr..label: Richard E. Dutrow, Jr.
Richard E. Dutrow, Jr..description:
Richard E. "Rick" Dutrow, Jr. is an American thoroughbred racehorse trainer. He is currently serving a ten-year suspension administered by the racing commission in New York.
His brother Anthony Dutrow is also a trainer. Wikipedia

Charles E. Whittingham.label: Charles E. Whittingham
Charles E. Whittingham.description: Charles Edward Whittingham was an American thoroughbred race horse trainer who is one of the most acclaimed trainers in U.S. racing history. Wikipedia
Charles E. Whittingham.Born: April 13, 1913, Chula Vista, California, United States

Stanley M. Hough.label: Stanley M. Hough
Stanley M. Hough.description: Stanley M. Hough born February 20, 1948 in Palatine, Illinois is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer. The son of Chicago-based Thoroughbred owner/trainer Joseph Hough, he embarked on a training career of his own in 1969. Wikipedia

Preston M. Burch.label: Preston M. Burch
Preston M. Burch.description: Preston Morris Burch was an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred racehorse trainer, breeder, and owner. Wikipedia

Jeff Mullins (racehorse trainer).label: Jeff Mullins
Jeff Mullins (racehorse trainer).description: Jeff Mullins is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. Wikipedia

Thomas Albertrani.label: Thomas Albertrani
Thomas Albertrani.description: Thomas "Tom" Albertrani is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. He began his career as a jockey then spent a number of years as an assistant to trainer Bill Mott. Wikipedia
Thomas Albertrani.Born: March 21, 1958 (age 56), Brooklyn, New York, United States

Kiaran McLaughlin.label: Kiaran McLaughlin
Kiaran McLaughlin.description: Kiaran P. McLaughlin is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. He currently has a blog website, at http//kiaranmclaughlin.com where he updates what horses he has racing for that particular day. Wikipedia

William H. Fires.label: William H. Fires
William H. Fires.description: William H. "Jinks" Fires is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. He is the trainer of 2011 Arkansas Derby winner Archarcharch which finished fifteenth in the Kentucky Derby. Wikipedia

Alan E. Goldberg.label: Alan E. Goldberg
Alan E. Goldberg.description: Alan E. Goldberg is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer. He began his career as a professional trainer in the early 1970s, serving as an apprentice to Walter Kelley from a base at New York's Aqueduct Racetrack. Wikipedia

Bruce N. Levine.label: Bruce N. Levine
Bruce N. Levine.description:
Bruce N. Levine is a trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses.
Raised on Long Island, New York, where he still makes his home, Levine earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Business Administration from the University of Miami before becoming a trainer. Wikipedia
Bruce N. Levine.Born: February 7, 1955 (age 59), New York City, New York, United States

Bob Baffert.label: Bob Baffert
Bob Baffert.description: Robert A. "Bob" Baffert is an American horse owner and trainer, whose horses have won three Kentucky Derbies, five Preakness Stakes, one Belmont Stakes and two Kentucky Oaks. Wikipedia

Richard O'Connell (racehorse trainer).label: Richard O'Connell
Richard O'Connell (racehorse trainer).description: Richard O'Connell was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer who was voted Trainer of the Year three times by New York Thoroughbred Breeders, Inc.. Wikipedia
Richard O'Connell (racehorse trainer).Born: December 14, 1949, Brooklyn, New York, United States

John M. Veitch.label: John M. Veitch
John M. Veitch.description: John M. Veitch is an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred horse trainer. The son of U.S. Racing Hall of Fame trainer Sylvester Veitch, he belongs to a family that has been in the horse-training business for three generations. Wikipedia

Winbert F. Mulholland.label: Winbert F. Mulholland
Winbert F. Mulholland.description:
Winbert F. "Bert" Mulholland was an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred horse racing trainer.
Born in Lexington, Kentucky, the American heartland for Thoroughbred horse breeding, Bert Mulholland began ... Wikipedia

Thomas J. Barry.label: Thomas J. Barry
Thomas J. Barry.description: Thomas J. "Tom" Barry was a trainer of Thoroughbred racehorse who won two American Classic Races with foreign-bred horses. Born in Ireland, as a young man he emigrated to the United States where he became a citizen around 1930. Wikipedia

Laz Barrera.label: Laz Barrera
Laz Barrera.description:
Lazaro Sosa Barrera was a Cuban-born American Hall of Fame thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
Born in Havana, "Laz" Barrera was one of nine brothers who went on to become involved in thoroughbred horse racing in the United States. Wikipedia

Roger Attfield.label: Roger Attfield
Roger Attfield.description: Roger L. Attfield is a Canadian thoroughbred horse trainer and owner and an inductee of both the Canadian and United States horseracing Halls of Fame. Wikipedia

Chad Brown (horse trainer).label: Chad Brown
Chad Brown (horse trainer).description:
Chad C. Brown is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer.
Brown who got into horses at an early age at an upstate New York track. He was an understudy to U.S. Racing Hall of Fame trainer Robert Frankel. Wikipedia

Neil J. Howard.label: Neil J. Howard
Neil J. Howard.description:
Neil J. Howard is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer.
Howard began working for a racing stable in 1969 and went on to spend seven years as an assistant and stable foreman to future Hall of ... Wikipedia
Neil J. Howard.Born: February 23, 1949 (age 65), Riverdale, New York City, New York, United States

Richard Hannon.label: Richard Hannon
Richard Hannon.description: Richard Hannon, Sr. is a British horse trainer based at Herridge Racing Stables, near Marlborough, Wiltshire, with a smaller yard at Everleigh on the edge of Salisbury Plain. Wikipedia

Maurice Zilber.label: Maurice Zilber
Maurice Zilber.description: Maurice Zilber was a thoroughbred horse trainer born and raised in Cairo, Egypt to a Turkish mother and a French-Hungarian father. He trained horses in Egypt from 1946 to 1962, and then moved to France where he worked for another 43 years. Wikipedia

Gil Rowntree.label: Gil Rowntree
Gil Rowntree.description:
Gil H. Rowntree is a Canadian Hall of Fame Thoroughbred racehorse trainer and owner.
One of the most successful trainers in Canadian Thoroughbred racing history, Rowntree embarked on his racing career ... Wikipedia

Thomas Hitchcock, Sr..label: Thomas Hitchcock, Sr.
Thomas Hitchcock, Sr..description: Thomas Hitchcock was one of the leading American polo players during the latter part of the 19th century and a Hall of Fame horse trainer and owner known as the father of American steeplechase horse racing. Wikipedia
Thomas Hitchcock, Sr..Born: November 23, 1860, Westbury, New York, United States

Macdonald Benson.label: Macdonald Benson
Macdonald Benson.description: Macdonald "Mac" Benson is a Canadian Horse Racing Hall of Fame trainer. A resident of Woodbridge, Ontario, Benson came to Canada in 1978 to train for E. P. Taylor's renowned Windfields Farm. Wikipedia

George M. Odom.label: George M. Odom
George M. Odom.description: George Martin Odom was an American National Museum of Racing and Hall of Fame jockey and trainer in Thoroughbred horse racing. He is only one of two people to ever have won the Belmont Stakes as both a jockey and a trainer. Wikipedia

John Scott (horseman).label: John Scott
John Scott (horseman).description: John Scott was a leading horse trainer in British Thoroughbred racing during the 19th century. Known as "The Wizard of the North," he was a brother to the successful jockey Bill Scott. Wikipedia

Dermot Weld.label: Dermot Weld
Dermot Weld.description:
Dermot K. Weld is one of Ireland's most successful racehorse trainers. He holds the record for the most winners trained in Ireland.
A qualified veterinarian and former jockey, Weld maintains his stable, Rosewell House, in Curragh, Ireland. Wikipedia

Alex Scott (racehorse trainer).label: Alex Scott
Alex Scott (racehorse trainer).description: Alexander Archibald Scott was a British thoroughbred racehorse trainer. In six seasons as a licence-holder Scott trained 164 winners. Wikipedia

John F. Meagher.label: John F. Meagher
John F. Meagher.description:
John Francis Meagher is a Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
He is a Melbourne Cup winning trainer who relocated to Singapore from Melbourne in 1999. Meagher trained What A Nuisance to a win in the 1985 Melbourne Cup. Wikipedia

Richard E. Handlen.label: Richard E. Handlen
Richard E. Handlen.description:
Richard E. "Dick" Handlen was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer whom the March 15, 1937 edition of the Los Angeles Times called "one of the best trainers in America"
Early in his career, ... Wikipedia

Thomas M. Amoss.label: Thomas M. Amoss
Thomas M. Amoss.description:
Thomas M. "Tom" Amoss is a trainer of Thoroughbred race horses.
A graduate of Louisiana State University with a degree in marketing and a member of Sigma Nu Fraternity, Tom Amoss had worked with horses ... Wikipedia
Thomas M. Amoss.Born: November 17, 1961 (age 52), New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

Melvin F. Stute.label: Melvin F. Stute
Melvin F. Stute.description: Melvin Frederick "Mel" Stute is an American trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses. On December 11, 2010, at Hollywood Park Racetrack, he won the 2000th race of a career that includes a win in the second ... Wikipedia
Melvin F. Stute.Born: August 8, 1927 (age 86), Fort Wayne, Indiana, United States

LeRoy Jolley.label: LeRoy Jolley
LeRoy Jolley.description: LeRoy S. Jolley is an United States Hall of Fame Thoroughbred horse trainer. The son of horse trainer Moody Jolley, LeRoy Jolley has been around horses all his life at age nineteen received a New York State trainer's license. Wikipedia

Noble Threewitt.label: Noble Threewitt
Noble Threewitt.description: Noble Threewitt was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer who conditioned horses for seventy-five years before retiring on his ninety-sixth birthday. Wikipedia

Ron McAnally.label: Ron McAnally
Ron McAnally.description: Ronald L. McAnally is an American Hall of Fame trainer in Thoroughbred horse racing. Called "one of the most honored and respected of North American trainers" by Thoroughbred Times Co., Inc, as a child, ... Wikipedia

Sarah A. Lundy.label: Sarah A. Lundy
Sarah A. Lundy.description:
Sarah A. Lundy is an American Thoroughbred horse trainer. In 1984 she became the first female trainer to ever saddle a horse in the Belmont Stakes, third leg of the U.S. Triple Crown series.
From 690 career starts, Sarah Lundy won 85 races. Wikipedia

Charles Peoples.label: Charles Peoples
Charles Peoples.description:
Charles Peoples was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
Charles and his twin sister Isabel Peoples were born in 1924 to Charles and Annie Peoples, both first-generation immigrants to Chester ... Wikipedia

Edward A. Neloy.label: Edward A. Neloy
Edward A. Neloy.description: Edward Albert "Eddie" Neloy was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer. At age fourteen, he began working at a racetrack then joined the United States Army during World War II. Wikipedia

John O. Hertler.label: John O. Hertler
John O. Hertler.description:
John O. Hertler is an American Thoroughbred horse trainer.
He was fifteen years old when he began working for Hall of Fame trainer Phil Johnson with whom he remained for thirteen years. Wikipedia
John O. Hertler.Born: September 17, 1950 (age 63), Ridgewood, New York, United States

Louie J. Roussel III.label: Louie Roussel III
Louie J. Roussel III.description: Louis J. Roussel, III, known as Louie Roussel, is an American businessman and a Thoroughbred racehorse owner and trainer who owned Fair Grounds Race Course and who won the final two legs of the 1988 ... Wikipedia
Louie J. Roussel III.Born: January 13, 1946 (age 68), New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

William H. Turner, Jr..label: William H. Turner, Jr.
William H. Turner, Jr..description: William H. "Billy" Turner, Jr. is a successful American Thoroughbred flat racing trainer who is best known for winning the United States Triple Crown of Thoroughbred Racing in 1977 with Seattle Slew, ... Wikipedia
William H. Turner, Jr..Born: February 29, 1940 (age 74), Rochester, New York, United States

Yonnie Starr.label: Yonnie Starr
Yonnie Starr.description: Joseph "Yonnie" Starr was a Canadian Hall of Fame Thoroughbred racehorse trainer about whom the Canadian Horse Racing Hall of Fame says has a "record unmatched in Canadian racing history." Wikipedia

John Servis.label: John Servis
John Servis.description: John C. Servis is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer who was relatively unknown until May 2004 when his horse Smarty Jones won the Kentucky Derby. The colt then went on to win the Preakness Stakes further increasing Servis' reputation. Wikipedia
John Servis.Born: October 25, 1958 (age 55), Charles Town, West Virginia, United States

Claude R. McGaughey III.label: Shug McGaughey
Claude R. McGaughey III.description:
Claude R. "Shug" McGaughey, III is an American Hall of Fame thoroughbred horse trainer.
McGaughey began working as a trainer in 1979 and to date has won more than 240 graded stakes races. Wikipedia

Michael Stoute.label: Michael Stoute
Michael Stoute.description: Sir Michael Ronald Stoute is a Barbadian British thoroughbred horse trainer in flat racing. Stoute, whose father was the Chief of police for Barbados, left the island in 1964 at the age of 19 to become ... Wikipedia

William J. Hirsch.label: William J. Hirsch
William J. Hirsch.description: William James "Buddy" Hirsch was an American Hall of Fame trainer of Thoroughbred racehorses. He was born in San Francisco, California, the son of Hall of Fame trainer, Max Hirsch. Wikipedia
William J. Hirsch.Born: January 11, 1909 (age 105), San Francisco, California, United States

Frank L. Brothers.label: Frank L. Brothers
Frank L. Brothers.description: Frank L. Brothers is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer who in 1991 won two of the three U.S. Triple Crown races. Wikipedia
Frank L. Brothers.Born: October 24, 1946 (age 67), New Orleans, Louisiana, United States

Mark A. Hennig.label: Mark A. Hennig
Mark A. Hennig.description:
Mark A. Hennig is an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer.
Born into a horse racing family, his father, John Hennig, was also a trainer. Wikipedia

Robert J. Frankel.label: Robert J. Frankel
Robert J. Frankel.description: Robert Julian Frankel was an American thoroughbred race horse trainer whom ESPN called "one of the most successful and respected trainers in the history of thoroughbred racing." Wikipedia
Robert J. Frankel.Born: July 9, 1941, Brooklyn, New York, United States

John T. Ward, Jr..label: John T. Ward, Jr.
John T. Ward, Jr..description: John T. Ward, Jr. is an American racehorse trainer. He is a graduate of the University of Kentucky with a degree in Agricultural Economics, where he was a member of Delta Tau Delta fraternity. Wikipedia

Sonny Hine.label: Sonny Hine
Sonny Hine.description: Hubert "Sonny" Hine was an American Hall of Fame Thoroughbred horse trainer best known as the trainer of 1998 U.S. Horse of the Year, Skip Away. Wikipedia
Sonny Hine.Born: January 9, 1931, The Bronx, New York City, New York, United States

Nick Zito.label: Nick Zito
Nick Zito.description:
Nicholas Philip "Nick" Zito is an American Thoroughbred horse trainer.
Zito began his career as a hot walker and worked his way up to a groom, to an assistant trainer, and to a trainer. Wikipedia
Nick Zito.Born: February 6, 1948 (age 66), Brooklyn, New York, United States

Virgil W. Raines.label: Virgil W. Raines
Virgil W. Raines.description:
Virgil W. Raines was an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
Known as "Buddy" Raines, in the 1930s he began working as a stable hand and became an exercise rider, notably for the U.S. Racing Hall of Fame colt Cavalcade. Wikipedia

Paul T. Adwell.label: Paul T. Adwell
Paul T. Adwell.description:
Paul T. Adwell was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer best known for winning the second leg of the U.S. Triple Crown series in 1976.
Between 1964 and 1991, Paul Adwell won 278 races at Arlington Park racetrack in Chicago. Wikipedia

John Shirreffs.label: John Shirreffs
John Shirreffs.description:
John A. Shirreffs is an American Thoroughbred racehorse trainer.
Based in California, Vietnam War veteran John Shirreffs began training Thoroughbreds in 1978. Wikipedia
John Shirreffs.Born: June 1, 1945 (age 68), Fort Leavenworth, Leavenworth, Kansas, United States

Edward A. Christmas.label: Edward A. Christmas
Edward A. Christmas.description: Edward A. Christmas was an American Thoroughbred horse racing trainer. Born in Upper Marlboro, Maryland, he is best known for training Gallorette, the 1946 American Champion Older Female Horse and U. S. Racing Hall of Fame inductee. Wikipedia
Edward A. Christmas.Born: October 10, 1903, Upper Marlboro, Maryland, United States
